main_point: The professor explains Polymerization: chain transfer and polydispersity and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes adsorption isotherm (a process) from overpotential (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving ligand and enantiomer.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a tools tangent to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for chemical shift shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
